definition:
An *equilateral triangle* is one for which all 3 sides are congruent.

The following statements hold in Euclidean geometry for an equilateral
triangle.

-   It is a regular polygon.

-   The bisector of any angle coincides with the height, the median and
    the perpendicular bisector of the .

-   If $r$ is the length of the side, then the height is equal to
    $\displaystyle \frac{r\sqrt{3}}{2}$.

-   If $r$ is the length of the side, then the area is equal to
    $\displaystyle \frac{r^2\sqrt{3}}{4}$.
